article.headline: Belmont 72, Mercer 47
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Matthew Dotson scored 15 points to lead Belmont to a 72-47 win over Mercer Sunday night. Mercer started with a 6-3 lead three minutes into the game, but a 14-5 Belmont run gave the team a 17-11 edge at nearly seven minutes in. Mercer took a 20-17 advantage after a 9-0 run of its own, but Belmont bounced back with a 15-2 run that put it up 32-24 at the break. Mercer continued to score in the second half, but couldn't catch Belmont, which held the Bears to just 29 percent shooting, while the Bruins shot 37 percent. Justin Hare contributed 11 points for the Bruins while Boomer Herndon added 10 rebounds. Mercer was led by James Florence. With 12 points, he was the only Bear to score in the double digits.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.
